lexUnit.name: slur.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: speak or articulate speech indistinctly.

sentence.text: ` Goodnight Maggie , " he slurred , swaying on the spot .
` Hi , Chris , " Elaine slurred , and patted a bar stool next to hers .
` Who are you ? " she slurred , close to fainting .
` You could be on th'devil'sh businesh , for ought we care , " he slurred .
Eventually at about 10pm she slurred : ` What time did you say we would have dinner ? "
` We 'll rule like kings , " Pike slurred .
` Ger 'em off ! " slurred one , to the amusement of his fellows .
` Never in this world , sir , " slurred Miller .
` It tasted good , " slurs Andrew , drunk but happy .
The Tibetan , growing ugly and aggressive , and slurring his speech , said that the trouble with Kalchu -- like everyone else round here -- was that he was ignorant , backward .
` She was slumped in the saddle and slurring her words .
His face was flushed , his eyes glinting with excitement ; he seemed to be having difficulty breathing , too , and he spoke so rapidly that he slurred his words .
Last night she banged on her door , slurring her words like a drunk ; demanding to be let out , I thought .
When she saw Meredith she said , ` Oh , hi ! " slurring the two syllables together and smiling uncertainly .
She was slurring her words and holding on to the bar-top for support .
" You 're still a mighty beautiful woman , my dear , " he said , slurring his words slightly .
Not only was the gentleman 's intonation unmistakably genteel , but he was slurring his words very slightly .
You did n't slur or stammer , your volume was fine , you were funny , your timing was good . "
` So does the knight , " Red Hand slurred and Athelstan caught the stench of wine fumes on his breath .
